description: From Turkish bey (“gentleman, chief”), from Ottoman Turkish بك‎ (beğ, bey), from Old Turkic 𐰋𐰏‎ (b²g /bég/, “chief, titled man”).

entries.meaning: (historical) A governor of a province or district in the Turkish dominions
examples: She was chaperoned by the widow of a Bey whose son had been at Oxford with him, and this gave him the excuse to exchange a few words with her, and then to be presented to the Princess.

entries.meaning: in various other places, a prince or nobleman
